file_insights.details: Added import statement for 5 inspection-related schema classes from inspection_template module
Auto-generated security configuration file listing allowed commands and detected project stack (Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, PHP with PostgreSQL and Redis)
Auto-generated status tracking file showing subtask 6 of 7 complete, schema implementation phase, session 6
Auto-generated Claude settings with sandbox enabled and comprehensive file/tool permissions configured
Added .auto-claude/ directory to gitignore to exclude auto-generated system files from version control

patterns_discovered.description: Session created 4 auto-generated system files for security, status tracking, and settings management
Inspection-related schemas (5 classes) consolidated into single import statement for cleaner module interface
Central __init__.py file aggregates all schema exports, providing single-source import point for application
Related schemas for inspection domain (ConsultantType, StageTemplate, ProjectInspection, Finding, and combined variants) grouped together

gotchas_discovered.description: Session automatically created 4 configuration files (.auto-claude-security.json, .auto-claude-status, .claude_settings.json). These appear to be system-managed files that should not require manual maintenance but increase repository clutter.
Single import line in __init__.py contains 5 schema classes, creating a lengthy statement that may affect code readability for maintenance purposes
.gitignore updated to exclude .auto-claude/ directory, indicating system-generated files should not be tracked. This dependency on external system state may affect reproducibility.

approach_outcome.summary: Subtask completed successfully in session 6 with single attempt
approach_outcome.actual_changes: Added 5 inspection schema class imports to the backend schema module's __init__.py file, consolidating inspection domain schemas
approach_outcome.notes: Task was straightforward import addition with no implementation complexity. Auto-system generated supporting configuration files alongside the primary code change.

recommendations.recommendation: Consider breaking the long import statement in __init__.py into multiple lines for improved readability, especially as inspection schemas expand
Verify that .auto-claude/ exclusion in .gitignore is complete and consistent. Monitor whether auto-generated configuration files should be tracked for reproducibility

The import of both base schemas (InspectionConsultantTypeResponse, ProjectInspectionResponse) and combined variants (InspectionConsultantTypeWithStages, ProjectInspectionWithFindings) suggests potential for schema composition patterns - consider documenting usage patterns
Document the auto-claude system configuration (security.json, status file) so team members understand these are auto-generated and should not be manually edited
